oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 9
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Roy Acuff's American Ace Coffee sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The recording features multiple recordings. The tape features: Tex Ritter (musician), Fred Rose (musician), Grant Turner (host), the Tennessee Belles (musical group), Jimmie Riddle (musician), Uncle Dave Macon (musician), Pap's Jug Band (musical group), the Smokey Mountain Band (musical group), Tommy Jackson (musician), and the Oswald and Joe (musical group). The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number nine of an unidentified number. The multiple recordings are from November 01, 1947.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Fred Rose; Grant Turner; Tennessee Belles; Jimmie Riddle; Uncle Dave Macon; Pap's Jug Band; Smokey Mountain Band; Tommy Jackson; Oswald and Joe
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:04) Highway to Heaven (Roy Acuff) -- (00:32) My Dream is You (Fred Rose) -- (03:19) American Ace Coffee Opening Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (04:00) Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- (04:28) It's too Late Now to Worry Anymore (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (06:44) Roly Poly (Tennessee Belles) -- (08:15) Grant Turner and Roy Acuff perform an American Ace Coffee commercial -- (09:26) Five Foot Two (Jimmie Riddle) -- (11:17) I Wish I Had Never Seen Sunshine (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (13:29) Turner introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- (14:29) Shame on You (Pap's Jug Band) -- (16:36) Life's Railway to Heaven (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (19:13) Turner and Acuff perform an American Ace Coffee commercial -- (20:02) Devil's Dream (Tommy Jackson) -- (21:40) Don't Let Your Sweet Love Die (Tennessee Belles) -- (23:40) Cor, Corrina (Oswald) -- (25:01) When My Blue Moon Turns to Gold Again (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (27:39) Dusty Miller (Tommy Jackson) -- (28:44) Acuff performs an American Ace Coffee commercial -- (29:03) Ida Red [features outro Grant Turner outro] (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Acuff, Roy; Rose, Fred, 1897-1954; Turner, Grant; Tennessee Belles; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Pap's Jug Band; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jackson, Tommy; Oswald and Joe;
